alternative_parents.description: Steroid derivatives carrying a C=O group at the 3-position of the steroid skeleton.
alternative_parents.name: 3-oxosteroids

alternative_parents.description: Steroids carrying a hydroxyl group at the 17-position of the steroid backbone.
alternative_parents.name: 17-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a cylohexenone moiety, which is a six-membered aliphatic ring that carries a ketone and has one endocyclic double bond.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclohexenones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the ynone functional group, an alpha,beta unsaturated ketone group with the general structure  RC#C-C(=O)R' (R'  not H).
alternative_parents.name: Ynones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds in which a hydroxy group, -OH, is attached to a saturated carbon atom R3COH (R not H ).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds arising by replacement of one or both hydrogen atoms of acetylene (ethyne) by a metal or other cationic group. E.g. NaC#CH monosodium acetylide. By extension, analogous compounds derived from terminal acetylenes, RC#CH. The class is limited here to derivatives of acetylene where the hydrogen atom is replaced with an element with similar or lower electronegativity that carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Acetylides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds based on the cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene carbon skeleton, partially or completely hydrogenated; there are usually methyl groups at C-10 and C-13, and often an alkyl group at C-17. By extension, one or more bond scissions, ring expansions and/or ring contractions of the skeleton may have occurred.
class.name: Steroids and steroid derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as estrogens and derivatives. These are steroids with a structure containing a 3-hydroxylated estrane.

direct_parent.description: Steroids with a structure containing a 3-hydroxylated estrane.
direct_parent.name: Estrogens and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Steroids with a structure based on the estrane skeleton.
subclass.name: Estrane steroids

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
